basic_info.description: Prior to my career change into the tech industry, I worked Air Transportation for the United States Air Force.  I enjoyed supporting missions that had real impacts all over the world but after talking to some friends who worked in the tech industry, I knew that I wanted a job that was more challenging and engaging. In preparation for my career change, I started my degree in computer science at UMGC. I had a great programming foundation but wasnâ€™t very familiar with building modern applications and using technologies that employers were looking for. To help with this, I joined Code Fellows and am learning full stack web development. Iâ€™m excited to take my leadership and communication skills learned in the Air Force, along with my software developer skills, and get a job in the tech industry

projects.title: Guess the Rainbow
projects.description: Guess the Rainbow is a fun kids game that requires problem solving to determine the correct combination and order of five different colors. The game was developed as a spin-off of Wordle, but the use of colors allows children who can't read or a person who doesn't speak English to play along as well.

projects.title: Odd Duck Products
projects.description: I built an app that displays three products and allows a user to vote for one. It records the amount of times each product is displayed and the number of times they vote for that project. The app finishes by displaying the results that were recorded. This app is used by Odd Duck to determine which products that users would be interested in.

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: This app showcases the work of a local charity. A user can go on this site to see the donation locations, donors, fundraising events, and how they can help the organization.
